result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Davis

9:39 AM Defendant James A Davis in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for James A Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests another status the defendant is seeking private counsel. 
BTC: Matter set over.

Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
RCAP - Progress Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 7/26/2022 to have RCAP testing only at court dates and random testing if RCAP decides

9:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James A Davis in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for James A Davis. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates the defendant has tested multiple times and is testing negative, requests testing be modified to only at court dates as he lives in Milwaukee. 
State has no objection. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Granted, to test at court dates only but RCAP may do random testing if they decide to.

records.addlTxt: Atty Elizabeth Angove
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant James A Davis appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for James A Davis. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.
